titleStmt.title: Indenture of covenant between Sir Thomas West, Lord La Warre and Robert Thorne 31 January, 1532

abstract.p: An indenture between Sir Thomas West and Robert Thorne on the foundation of a grammer school in Bristol.
I would like to thank the archivist of Bristol Grammar School for access to the document.

div.p:
This indenture maed the last day of January in the xxiijti yere of the reigne of Kyng Harry the Viijth bitwene the Right Honorable sir Thomas West Knyght Lorde Lawarre of the one partie And Roberte Thorne Citzene
&and merchuant of London on the other partie Witnessithe that it is covenantid &and agreid bitwene the sayd parties in manner &and forme folowing That is to sey the seyde Robert Thorne covenantithe guantith &and agreethe to &and wtwith the seyd
Lorde Lawarre that if a sure sufficient &and indeficiable indefeasible estate in fee simple be made or causid to be maed or conveyd by the seyd Lorde Lawarre &and one George Croft master of the House & and Hospitall of seint Bartilmews
in the subarbes of the towne of Bristowe or by any of them to the seid Robert Thorne & and to Nicholas Thorne & and oon John Goodriche Clerke or to the overlyvers of them & and their heires as shalbe Avised by the lernyd councell
of the seid Roberte Thorne or his heires wtin within one yere next after the date hereof of &and in the seid House &and Hospitall of seint bartilmews and of &and in all the lordshippes manors messuages londes tenementes rentes reversions
&and services wtwith their appurtenances whiche be taken usid reputid or accepted as parcell of the seid house or hospitall or as parcell of the landes or tenementes rentes reversions or services to the seyd house or hospitall in any manner
apperteynyng or belonginge or whiche the seid George Croft master of the seid house or hospitall &and Brethern &and Susterne of the same or any of them have had holden or enyoied as in the right of the seid
house or hospitall That then the seyd Roberte Thorn wtin within the space & and terme of vj yeres next ymmediatly after the date hereof shall ordein prepare &and make a convenyent Scolehouse for a fre grammer scole to be
tawght &and kepte wtin within the town of Bristowe or wtin within the subarbes of the same uppon the seyd house or hospitall or uppon sum parte of the seid londes or tenementes belonging to the seyd house or hospitall
And also the same Robert wtin within the same terme shall provyde Establyshe &and ordein A Scolemaster &and an Ushier to teche &and kepe the seyd fre scole wtwith suche convenyent wages to them to be appoynted as shall
or may convenyently come of the rentes issues &and profittes of the seyd landes and also the same Robert shall oppoynt make &and Establyshe wtwith in thesame terme of vj yeres the foundacon statutes &and ordynances of the
seyde scole after the mynde &and advise of John Barlowe deane of Westbury upon Trym in the countie of Glocester and of the forseyd George Croft Robert Thorne Nicholas Thorne & and John Goodriche Clerke
or of iiij or iij of them at laste wherof the seide George Croft to be one if he be lyvyng by indentures &and wrytinges tripartite Wherof one parte shall remayne allweys wt with the seyde Lorde Lawarre & and his heires an other
parte with the meyre &and comynaltie of the seid towne of Bristowe &and the therd parte with the seyd Roberte Thorne &and his heyres for ever And the said Robert convenantith to &and wtwith the seid Lorde Lawarre by this presentes that
uppon the seid foundacon Statutes &and ordynances the seid lorde Lawarre shalbe mayde &and reputid as one of the prcypall princypall founders of the sed scole and the seyd George Croft to be namyd &and taken a singular benefactor
thereof And also that upon the seid foundacon &and writynges suche articles &and agrementes as here after folowith shallbe put ordeynd &and oppyntid therin That is to sey that there shalbe a solempne obit kepte yerely
for ever at the xjth day of october at the seyd Bartilmews to praye for the soules of the Lorde Lawarre John &and Robert &and of Sir Thomas now Lorde Lawarre &and for the soules of Sir Thomas West Knyght late lorde
Lawarre Thomas West, seventh Baron West and eighth Baron de la Warr (1448 - 1525) &and Elizabeth his wyff late fadr fader & and modr moder to the seid nowe lord Lawarre &and for the soules of all their antecessors &and progenitors &and this obit to be kepte wt with x pristes &and vj Clerkes at which obit ther shalbe delte
&and distrybute in almes amonges poore people a Hundreth pens at lest Also that the Scolemaster &and Ushier shall oppoynt &and assign the Scolers of the seid Scole to sey suche certeyn pryers prayers at their departyng in the Evenyng as
shalbe devysyd or oppoynted by the seyd lorde lawarre and also the seyde Robert Thorne covenantith &and guantith that all suche almes people as nowe be in the seyd house or hospitall of the seyd Bartilmews shall
nott be put awey but still to continue there & and have every weke v d a pece duryng their lyves if they will and also that there shalbe a prist founde there to prye praye for the soules of the founders &and benefactors untill
suche tyme as the seyde scole be ordained &and made and also a scole master resident &and in possession thers for the wch which articles covenantes & and agreementes before rehersyd on the partie of the seyd Robert to be performed & and kepte
and for dyvers other consideracions had & and done by the seyd Robert Thorne to the seyde Thomas West Knyght Lorde Lawarre The same Thomas covenantith & and guantith to renownce &and relinquysh &and by these presentes doth utterly
renownce &and relinquishe all his interest titell right & and clayme as well in the seide house hospitall &and other the premisses as in the patronage or foundacon thereof savyng onely to hym suche preemynens in his name of the seyd
foundacon &and in suche payers payres & and suffrages as before is rehercyd In witness whereof the parties aforseyd to thes indentures interchaungable every to other have put their seales the day &and year aforseyd
